snippet: Gov. Jay Nixon did not say why he commuted the sentence of Kimber Edwards, on death row for hiring someone to murder his former wife, to life without parole.
abstract: Missouri Gov Jay Nixon commutes inmate Kimber Edwards's death sentence to life without parole after lawyers for Edwards present evidence suggesting he is innocent of 2000 murder of his former wife Kimberly Cantrell; Edwards was to have been seventh person executed in state in 2015.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Jay Nixon did not say why he commuted the sentence of Kimber Edwards, on death row for hiring someone to murder his former wife, to life without parole.

headline.main: Missouri Inmate Is Spared Death Sentence
headline.print_headline: Missouri Inmate Is Spared Death Sentence
